manuscript_citation: Aw WC, Towarnicki SG, Melvin RG, Youngson NA, Garvin MR, Hu Y, Nielsen S, Thomas T, Pickford R, Bustamante S, Vila-Sanjurjo A, Smyth GK, Ballard JWO (2018) Genotype to phenotype: Diet-by-mitochondrial DNA haplotype interactions drive metabolic flexibility and organismal fitness. PLoS Genet 14(11): e1007735. doi: 10.1371/journal.pgen.1007735

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"6q0oj","text":"To determine mtDNA copy number, total DNA was extracted using DNeasy Blood and Tissue Kit (Qiagen #69582).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2d6p0","text":"The relative fold change of mtDNA copy number was determined by quantitative PCR (qPCR) using a 72 well Rotorgene-3000 (Corbett Research, Cambridge, UK) with Sybr Green (Bio-Rad, CA, USA).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"40h2a","text":"The mtDNA was quantified by amplifying ND4 and the nuclear gene Act88 and corroborated independently by amplifying lrRNA and the nuclear gene rp49\u00a0using the following primers: ND4 forward 5\u2019-AACTGGAGCTTCAACATGAGC-3\u2019, reverse 5\u2019-AGCCAGAACGTTTACAAGCTG-3\u2019; Act88 forward 5\u2019-ATCGAGCACGGCATCATCAC-3\u2019, reverse 3\u2019-CACGCGCAG CTCGTTGTA-5\u2019; lrRNA forward 5\u2019-TCGTCCAACCATTCATTCC-3\u2019, reverse 3\u2019-ATAAAGTCTAACCTGCCCACTGA-5\u2019; rp49 forward 5\u2019-AGATCGTGAAGAAGCGCACC-3\u2019, reverse 3\u2019-CACCAGGAACTTCTTGAATC-5\u2019.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":63,"length":6,"style":"italic"},{"offset":142,"length":5,"style":"italic"},{"offset":254,"length":5,"style":"italic"},{"offset":411,"length":4,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2bggf","text":"The qPCR program included denaturing at 95\u00b0 C for 5 min and amplification in 40 cycles of 95\u00b0 C for 10 s followed by 60\u00b0 C for 30 s.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b37l1","text":"Amplification was followed by a melting curve from 72\u00b0 C to 95\u00b0 C, rising by steps of 0.5\u00b0 C, to verify that a single product was amplified.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6nmts","text":"The mean Ct values of the mitochondrial-encoded genes ranged from 10.3-13.2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5sdtn","text":"The mean Ct values of the housekeeping genes ranged from 16.2-19.4.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b8rip","text":"The mtDNA copy number was expressed as fold change of mean mtDNA copy number relative to Alstonville.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
